title: 103_hr2071
content: The Act may be cited as the "District of Columbia Legislative and Budget Autonomy Act of 1993". References in the Act are considered to be made to the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act. The Act also addresses District of Columbia budget autonomy. The District of Columbia Budget Autonomy Act of 1993 amends Section 446 by specifying that no funds can be spent without approval from Congress, the Council, or the President under certain conditions. Amendments are made to other sections for consistency. The District of Columbia Budget Autonomy Act of 1993 amends Section 446 by changing the reference from the "fourth sentence" to the "second sentence." Section 412(a) is also amended by removing the phrase "(other than an act to which section 446 applies)." Additionally, clerical amendments are made to the heading of section 446. The District of Columbia Budget Autonomy Act of 1993 amends section 446 in the table of contents to change the reference from the "fourth sentence" to the "second sentence." Section 446 is amended to enact the budget by the Council, while section 404(f) is modified to remove references to the Chairman transmitting to the President. Section 447 is amended to allow hiring based on Council acts, and section 603 is amended to remove certain subsections related to federal authority over the budget-making process. The amendments in this section involve redesignating subsections and making conforming amendments to various sections of the D.C. Code. The effective date for these changes is for fiscal years starting on or after October 1, 1993. Elimination of congressional review of newly-passed district laws. The District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act is amended by eliminating congressional review of newly-passed district laws. This includes striking subsection (c) of Section 602 and section 604, along with related amendments to the table of contents. The District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act is amended to eliminate congressional review of newly-passed district laws. This includes changes to various sections and subsections within the Act. The District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act is amended to remove congressional review of new district laws. This involves revisions to multiple sections and subsections within the Act, such as striking specific language and inserting periods in certain sections. The District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act is amended to remove congressional review of new district laws. The amendments involve changes to subsections (j)(2) and (m), including striking specific language and inserting periods in certain sections. The effective date of these amendments applies to acts passed by the Council of the District of Columbia and signed by the Mayor of the District of Columbia. The District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act outlines the process for enacting new laws in the district. This includes laws being signed by the Mayor, vetoed and repassed by the Council, passed by the Council without the Mayor's signature, or ratified by a majority of registered voters for initiated acts or acts subject to referendum, after October 1, 1993.
